intro: Zornia acauensis, commonly known as the Acauense Zornia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Zornia acauensis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native environment.
